Also, I did a rudimentary test of the Text, Swing and AWT TestRunners
but I'm still not totally clear on all the usages of TestSuite and
whatnot, so it'd be great if someone with a nice, big, fat,
complicated set of tests would install my patch, remove all their
constructors, and give it a whirl.  That'd make me more confident.

Thanks -

 - Alex


On Sat, Mar 23, 2002 at 12:28:33PM -0800, guru@... wrote:
> I just made a patch for JUnit to fix the long-standing annoyance of
> having to declare
> 
> 	public MyTestCase(String name) 
> 	{
> 		super(name);
> 	}
> 
> at the top of every single TestCase ever written.  Talk about removing
> duplication!
> 
> Download from http://www.purpletech.com/junit-patch/
> 
> My patched JUnit will happily instantiate a TestCase with no
> constructor (that is, with the default no-arg constructor that the
> compiler sticks in there automatically), and then call its setName()
> method.
>
